content:
l sin standeth not in the following of Adam (as the Pelagians
do vainly talk), but it is the fault and corruption of the Nature of every man that naturally is
engendered of the offspring of Adam; whereby man is very far gone from original righteous-
ness, and is of his own nature inclined to evil, so that the flesh lusteth always contrary to the
Spirit; and therefore in every person born into this world, it deserveth God’s wrath and
damnation.  And  this  infection  of  nature  doth  remain,  ye
